Creating Shows
The process of creating a PhotoPulse show is simple.
To let PhotoPulse do the hard work, first check the View menu and make sure you are not currently in Expert Mode. When you are not in Expert Mode, PhotoPulse does most of the work for you, but you have less control over how the final show appears.
Use the Photos... button to open the photos to include in your show. If you want a music soundtrack in your show, use the Music... button to open an MP3 file. Finally, Create... will prompt you to choose the type of show to create and enter a filename for the show.
If your show has an MP3 soundtrack, when you create a show PhotoPulse will automatically adjust the show so that your photos play the entire time the soundtrack is playing. It does this by repeating photos in your show if needed to "pad" out the show to fill the MP3 duration. It may also temporarily remove photos from the final show if there are too many photos to fit within a short MP3. You can adjust this behavior by changing the speed at which the show plays (the length of time each photo is displayed). See see .
Each time you create your show, PhotoPulse will choose a new random set of transitions and effects for each photo. It will choose transitions and effects from the set that you have selected on the Transitions and Effects Tabs (see ).
Each of these steps is covered in more detail in the following sections.
The description above applies to shows created when not in Expert Mode. If you want more control over creating shows, you can turn on Expert Mode. See for more information.
